title: How to Increase Internal Memory of Any Android Phone

steps.title: Tap the “Downloads” app.
steps.content: Tap the “Downloads” app. The “Downloads” app is located in the app drawer of your Android. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Menu icon.
steps.content: Tap the Menu icon. The Menu icon appears in the upper right hand corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap and hold a download.
steps.content: Tap and hold a download. Select unwanted downloads by tapping and holding for a few seconds. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat the process as needed.
steps.content: Repeat the process as needed.

steps.title: Tap the Trash icon to delete.
steps.content: Tap the Trash icon to delete. Unwanted downloads will be permanently removed and you'll have more internal memory. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the “Settings” icon.
steps.content: Tap the “Settings” icon. The Settings icon is located in your app drawer. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Swipe the “All” tab.
steps.content: Swipe the “All” tab. Swipe over the “All” tab listed in the top center of the screen for a complete list of all the applications on your Android.

steps.title: Tap the app to disable.
steps.content: Tap the app to disable.

steps.title: Tap the “Disable” tab.
steps.content: Tap the “Disable” tab. A prompt will appear stating that other applications may be affected, however this is okay since you are not completely removing the app. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap “Ok”.
steps.content: Tap “Ok”.

steps.title: Tap the “Clear Data” tab.
steps.content: Tap the “Clear Data” tab. This is located in the App Info section.

steps.title: Tap the “Clear Cache” tab.
steps.content: Tap the “Clear Cache” tab. This is located in the App info section. Now you have removed unnecessary software, freed up some space and increased your internal memory.

steps.title: Tap the “Settings” icon.
steps.content: Tap the “Settings” icon. The “Settings" icon is located in the app drawer of your Android. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on “Storage”.
steps.content: Tap on “Storage”.

steps.title: Tap on “Cached data”.
steps.content: Tap on “Cached data”.

steps.title: Tap “OK” to clear cached data for all apps.
steps.content: Tap “OK” to clear cached data for all apps. You now have successfully removed cookies and pages will begin to load faster. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Google Photos app.
steps.content: Tap the Google Photos app. The app is located in the app drawer on your Android. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Menu.
steps.content: Tap the Menu.

steps.title: Tap the “Settings” tab.
steps.content: Tap the “Settings” tab.

steps.title: Tap “Back up & Sync”.
steps.content: Tap “Back up & Sync”. Photos that are not backed up will appear with an icon of a cloud with a strike through it.

steps.title: Tap the return arrow.
steps.content: Tap the return arrow. Tap the arrow at the upper left hand of the screen to return to the main screen.

steps.title: Tap the Photo icon.
steps.content: Tap the Photo icon. The Photo icon is found at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Touch and hold a photo.
steps.content: Touch and hold a photo. Touch and hold down all the videos or photos you wish to remove. A check mark will appear once the photo has been selected. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat the process as needed.
steps.content: Repeat the process as needed.

steps.title: Tap the “Trash” icon.
steps.content: Tap the “Trash” icon. The Trash icon is found at the upper right hand side of the screen.

steps.title: Tap “Delete”.
steps.content: Tap “Delete”. A prompt will appear asking you to confirm you want to delete your selected photos. Tap “Delete” to permanently remove photos or videos from your Google Photos app.

steps.title: Download the GOM Saver app from the Google Play Store.
steps.content: Download the GOM Saver app from the Google Play Store.

steps.title: Launch GOM Saver, default mode will be set.
steps.content: Launch GOM Saver, default mode will be set.

steps.title: You can see how much memory you can save by running the video or image compression.
steps.content: You can see how much memory you can save by running the video or image compression.

steps.title: You can delete the original file or cloud back it up.
steps.content: You can delete the original file or cloud back it up.

steps.title: The compressed image or video will be left on your phone.
steps.content: The compressed image or video will be left on your phone.

steps.title: Average saving is about 50% of the original file amount.
steps.content: Average saving is about 50% of the original file amount. (Example: 5 gigs of photos will be 2.5 gig)

steps.title: Download the Link2SD app.
steps.content: Download the Link2SD app. Download the app from the Google Play Store.

steps.title: Turn off your phone.
steps.content: Turn off your phone. You must use volume keys to navigate and the power/home button to select, as touch does not work in recovery mode.

steps.title: Tap the Link2SD app.
steps.content: Tap the Link2SD app. The application is located in your app drawer.

steps.title: Tap the “Advanced” option.
steps.content: Tap the “Advanced” option. This appears in the drop down list of options.

steps.title: Tap the “Partition sdcard" option.
steps.content: Tap the “Partition sdcard" option. This appears in the Advanced menu’s drop down list of options. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the ext size.
steps.content: Tap the ext size. This size should be smaller than your memory card size.

steps.title: Tap the swap size.
steps.content: Tap the swap size. The swap size should be zero.

steps.title: Wait a few moments.
steps.content: Wait a few moments.

steps.title: Select "+++++go back+++++".
steps.content: Select "+++++go back+++++".

steps.title: Select “reboot system now”.
steps.content: Select “reboot system now”.

steps.title: Start phone.
steps.content: Start phone.

steps.title: Install the Link2SD app.
steps.content: Install the Link2SD app. This is located in the app drawer of your phone

steps.title: Tap the Link2SD app.
steps.content: Tap the Link2SD app.

steps.title: Click “Allow” Superuser permissions.
steps.content: Click “Allow” Superuser permissions.

steps.title: Select "Ext2".
steps.content: Select "Ext2". This option will appear in a pop-up. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Select “Ok” to reboot.
steps.content: Select “Ok” to reboot.

steps.title: Tap the Link2SD app.
steps.content: Tap the Link2SD app.

steps.title: Tap the “Filter” icon.
steps.content: Tap the “Filter” icon. This appears at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the “On Internal” option.
steps.content: Tap the “On Internal” option.

steps.title: Tap the “Option” icon.
steps.content: Tap the “Option” icon.

steps.title: Tap the “Multi-select” option.
steps.content: Tap the “Multi-select” option.

steps.title: Tap the “Option” icon.
steps.content: Tap the “Option” icon.

steps.title: Tap the “Create link” option
steps.content: Tap the “Create link” option

steps.title: Tap “Link application file”.
steps.content: Tap “Link application file”.

steps.title: Tap “Link dalvik cache file”.
steps.content: Tap “Link dalvik cache file”.

steps.title: Tap “Link library files”.
steps.content: Tap “Link library files”.

steps.title: Tap “Ok”.
steps.content: Tap “Ok”.

steps.title: Wait a few moments.
steps.content: Wait a few moments.

steps.title: Tap “Ok”.
steps.content: Tap “Ok”. You have successfully moved your apps and other data to your SD card.
